definition: addicted to/fond of/stem corresponding to -phil or -phile
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello

sentences.english: I prefer some sort of oversizedr level. preferstomair-conhly the twentieth floor or higher.
sentences.chinese: 我嗜好较高层的，最好是二十楼或以上。

sentences.english: During the years of Jiajing in Ming Dynasty, a scholar named Fan Qin had a hobby in collecting books.
sentences.chinese: 明代嘉靖年间有一个人叫范钦，一生嗜好藏书。

sentences.english: Thesame old favourites recur year in year out with monotonous regularity.
sentences.chinese: 一些相同的老嗜好年复一年地以单调的规律重现。

sentences.english: Identity doesn't relly matter when you're in a chat room discussing politics or hobbies.
sentences.chinese: 当你在聊天室讲座政治或嗜好时，身份并不那么重要。

sentences.english: I dropped my hobby and turned professional.
sentences.chinese: 我把我的嗜好变成了职业。

sentences.english: My favorite hobby is bungee jumping.
sentences.chinese: 我最大的嗜好就是蹦极跳。

sentences.english: He had the animal pleasures of a strong man.
sentences.chinese: 他有着强壮男人的动物性嗜好。

sentences.english: Hear them talk about their sweet-eating habits.
sentences.chinese: 听听她们谈论各自的甜食嗜好吧。

sentences.english: My work was like an addiction.
sentences.chinese: 我的工作就像是一个嗜好。

sentences.english: The brain also has a penchant for symmetry.
sentences.chinese: 大脑同样对对称别有嗜好。

sentences.english: Shanghai has its European eccentricity, but little prepares you for the Gothic towers.
sentences.chinese: 上海有欧式的嗜好，却没有哥特式建筑的沉重。

sentences.english: The two sisters have very little in common in their taste and manner.
sentences.chinese: 这两姐妹的嗜好和举止很少相同。

sentences.english: Reading such silly stories will pervert your taste for good books.
sentences.chinese: 读这种愚昧的故事会败坏你对好书的嗜好。

sentences.english: Tim and Donald discuss their hobbies.
sentences.chinese: 提姆和唐诺在讨论彼此的嗜好。

sentences.english: Never smoking, no any bad habits, how can she got the lung cancer?
sentences.chinese: 不抽烟，没有任何不良嗜好，何以得了肺癌？

sentences.english: The balloonist liked to deep sea dive as a hobby.
sentences.chinese: 该名气球驾驶员喜欢把深海潜泳当做嗜好。

definition: to like/to take pleasure in/keen on/fond of/interest/hobby/appetite for/CL:個|个[ge4]
to like/fond of/to prefer/to love/one's tastes/preference
to love wine as one's life (idiom); fond of the bottle
heavy drinking/to get drunk/to drink to excess
character acquired through long habit/habits and properties
to be keen on/to have a passion for
